intro: Oropetium villosulum, commonly known as the hairy oropetium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves with a central flowering stem. Oropetium villosulum is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
